description.narrative: The revised development objectives are: (i) to improve water use efficiency in the selected irrigation schemes; and (ii) to foster immediate rural employment.

provider-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

comment.narrative: Activities of the project will create new employment opportunities, through temporary jobs, thus the baseline is assumed to be zero.

Target exceeded. According to the information obtained from contractors' monthly lists of personnel, 17,136 man-month temporaryrural employment was generated as of May 16, 2013, compared with the target of 16,000 man-month. This number will increase by theend of the Project as rehabilitation activities on tertiaries still continue
All water users that are in the project area could be considered as beneficiaries. The original project area has 30,000 water users.

In total, the number of water user beneficiaries of the original Project and AF is 118,000 water users. However, the projectbeneficiaries are also those who worked on construction sites: from neighboring areas as well as from other regions. Based on veryconservative estimation in order to avoid double counting of water user beneficiaries involved in construction works during winterseason, we may state that some 2,000 additional people involved in rehabilitation works also benefited from Project activities.

title.narrative: Restored irrigation area in communities with rehabilitated tertiary network (this is a new indicator for a new component 2).

comment.narrative: Because of deteriorated state of tertiary system and high water losses in selected communities come number of hectares was notcultivated. With rehabilitation of tertiary canals, more water will become available and consequently more land will be cultivated.

Given that most of rehabilitation activities have been completed ans some are still underway, we do expect some increase inirrigation area during 2013 agricultural season, which could be validated at the end of the season.
Before the project none of the 44 existing WUAs has a business plan
The activity has been completed under the original project

title.narrative: GIS system is in place in all operating WUAs

comment.narrative: For 18 WUAs the GIS system was installed under the previous (now closed) Irrigation Development Project.

The baseline value was 18 of 44 WUAs. The implementation of the activity for the remaining 26 WUAs is underway. The Bank agreedthat MCC takes over financing of this activity and provided MCC with all relevant documentation and information but continuouslymonitoring implementation progress. Currently the GIS system is installed in all 44 WUAs.

title.narrative: Reduction of water losses in the selected primary irrigation schemes.

comment.narrative: For main canal this level of losses is considered high. This indicator includes both water losses in main canals as well as intertiaries, rehabilitation of which was included under the AF as a new component.

Target achieved. This indicator relates to the 1st component of the project, which is rehabilitation of main canals. Given thatabout 147.5 km of selected canals sections have been rehabilitated, it was estimated that water losses were reduced from 23% to6-7%. In volumetric terms the water losses were reduced from 114 MCM to 17 MCM under the original Project and from 40 MCM to 6 MCMunder AF.

title.narrative: Area provided with irrigation and drainage services (ha)

comment.narrative: The baseline value of irrigated area is available from the GIS-based software installed in all WUAs.

Target not yet achieved but will be reached by the end of project implementation. Considering that more than 100 percent of theplanned rehabilitation works on primary canals and 95 percent of works on tertiary canals are completed and water losses arereduced, it is estimated that irrigation services are available on 56,156 ha. After completion of rehabilitation of the remaining2.5 km of tertiaries the target will be reached.
The current existing practice of an annual state subsidy allocation to the sector is deemed to be not effective.
The activity has been completed under the original project.

title.narrative: Number of permanent agricultural jobs created

comment.narrative: The project will be tracking new agricultural jobs created as a result of project activities.

Target not yet achieved. During 2012 agricultural season the number of permanent agricultural jobs was estimated to be around1,600. This number is estimated based on the information the PIU obtained through the GIS-based system installed in WUAs offices.The new information may become available only after the 2013 irrigation/agricultural season

title.narrative: Potential increase of total irrigation area as a result of rehabilitation works on main/secondary canals (IREP/AF)

comment.narrative: This number is derived from the 2008 factual WUA map

The target is reached. Given that all rehabilitation activities planned on main/secondary canals are completed and water lossesminimized, we may state that all initially estimated 83,210 ha could be potentially irrigated.

title.narrative: Value of wages generated (based on average pay per day)

comment.narrative: Total value of wages generated by temporary jobs for the rural population
Target exceeded. Given that average per day wage is 7,000 AMD and number of temporary jobs created, we calculated the value ofwages generated since Project effectiveness.

title.narrative: Area provided with irrigation and drainage services - New (ha)

comment.narrative: The above number refers to the restored back to irrigation area. After completion of rehabilitation of the remaining 2.5 km oftertiaries the target of 6,551 ha will be reached.

title.narrative: Area provided with irrigation and drainage services - Improved (ha)

comment.narrative: After rehabilitation of all identified sections of the included under the project canals, water losses will reduce substantiallyand consequently the irrigation services on the original irrigated area will improve notably.
The original irrigated area receives better irrigation services since water losses have been reduced.
